name: ClosedRange
desc: An interval from a lower bound up to, and including, an upper bound.

items.name: static func ... (Self, Self) -> ClosedRange<Self>
items.desc: Returns a closed range that contains both of its bounds.

items.name: func relative<C>(to: C) -> Range<Bound>
items.desc: Returns the range of indices described by this range expression within the given collection.

items.name: var isEmpty: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value indicating whether the range contains no elements.

items.name: let lowerBound: Bound
items.desc: The range’s lower bound.

items.name: let upperBound: Bound
items.desc: The range’s upper bound.

items.name: func contains(Bound) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the given element is contained within the range.

items.name: static func ~= (ClosedRange<Bound>, Bound) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether a value is included in a range.

items.name: func clamped(to: ClosedRange<Bound>) -> ClosedRange<Bound>
items.desc: Returns a copy of this range clamped to the given limiting range.

items.name: static func == (ClosedRange<Bound>, ClosedRange<Bound>) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether two ranges are equal.

items.name: static func != (ClosedRange<Bound>, ClosedRange<Bound>) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether two values are not equal.

items.name: func overlaps(Range<Bound>) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether this range and the given range contain an element in common.

items.name: func overlaps(ClosedRange<Bound>) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether this range and the given range contain an element in common.

items.name: func hash(into: inout Hasher)
items.desc: Hashes the essential components of this value by feeding them into the given hasher.

items.name: var description: String
items.desc: A textual representation of the range.

items.name: var debugDescription: String
items.desc: A textual representation of the range, suitable for debugging.

items.name: var customMirror: Mirror
items.desc: The custom mirror for this instance.

items.name: func encode(to: Encoder)
items.desc: Encodes this value into the given encoder.

items.name: init(from: Decoder)
items.desc: Creates a new instance by decoding from the given decoder.

items.name: init(uncheckedBounds: (lower: Bound, upper: Bound))
items.desc: Creates an instance with the given bounds.

items.name: var hashValue: Int
items.desc: The hash value.

items.name: func relative(toShapedArrayAxis: Range<Int>) -> Range<Int>
items.desc: Available when Bound is Int.
